text:
Celso Piña (April 6, 1953 – August 21, 2019) was a Mexican singer-songwriter, composer, arranger, and accordionist. He was born Monterrey, Nuevo León. His most popular songs include, "La quebradita de la paz", "El tren", "Como el viento" and "La piragua" by José Barros. He was featured in the song "Sufran con lo que yo gozo" along with Mexican singer Gloria Trevi.
On August 21, 2019, Piña died from a heart attack in Monterrey at the age of 66.
